author: Jason & Kelly

review: GOOGLE CHROMECASTThe Chromecast is essential if you have a smartphone/Chromebook and an HDTV. It allows you to stream and control a variety of apps from your phone or computer on your TV without the hassle of an HDMI cable. It is compatible with most android phones with jelly bean (4.1) or later and most recent iPhone models as well as Chromebooks and other computers through the chrome browser.A decent assortment of apps are supported by the Chromecast. The user can watch Netflix, Hulu+ or listen to Google play music. Some apps on smartphones do not have support for Chromecast such as amazon's prime instant video, but new apps are constantly being added.The design and interface is nothing spectacular. Instead it is extremely simple and straightforward. Moving the watching experience from one's device to the TV is as simple as tapping/clicking the "cast" button. In addition to the Chromecast, the Chromecast app needs to be downloaded on a smartphone or in chrome. This free app allows for easy setup and access to settings.The Google Chromecast streamlines a living room experience allowing you to control the TV with your phone or laptop. Some may want a dedicated streaming box such as an apple TV, Roku or Fire TV. I found that the Chromecast allowed me to do everything I would with any other streaming box simply and with great ease. Rating 5 out of 5 stars.
